title: A driving force in Asia Pacific’s clean energy evolution
summary: 2023 has been a year of building alliances for clean energy solutions provider Gentari, as it positions itself as a driving force in Asia Pacific’s clean energy evolution.
content:
2023 has been a year of building alliances for clean energy solutions provider Gentari, as it positions itself as a driving force in Asia Pacific’s clean energy evolution.

In the pursuit of advancing clean energy solutions towards a net zero future, Gentari has demonstrated its commitment through a series of achievements last year, building upon its early moves in 2022.

summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Umno president Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi has been scheduled to head to Kota Kinabalu, Sabah on Sunday night to resolve issues regarding Sabah Umno.
content:

Answering reporters’ questions about the current situation with Sabah Umno, Ahmad Zahid said he would issue an official statement about the matter in Sabah on Monday (Jan 8).

title: Techtalk: Pulling the plug
summary: Start-ups run the risk of failure from the get-go. Founders encounter problems such as insufficient cash flow, not achieving the optimum product and market fit and unconducive working environments due to employees or even the founders not getting along. Worse still, all the puzzle pieces could be...
content:
This article first appeared in Digital Edge, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on January 8, 2024 - January 14, 2024

Start-ups run the risk of failure from the get-go. Founders encounter problems such as insufficient cash flow, not achieving the optimum product and market fit and unconducive working environments due to employees or even the founders not getting along. Worse still, all the puzzle pieces could be in place, and yet a start-up could fail due to plain dumb luck.

title: Bursa likely to trend higher in 1,470 to 1,500 range
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trend higher this week, moving in the 1,470 to 1,500 range on persistent optimism for the local bourse.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trend higher this week, moving in the 1,470 to 1,500 range on persistent optimism for the local bourse.

Rakuten Trade equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said, fuelled by favourable market indicators, the FBM KLCI is forecast to remain above the 1,465 level for an extended period, a threshold it struggled to maintain several times last year.

title: Short sellers see distress emerging in apartments
summary: NEW YORK: Soaring rents and cheap funding made blocks of US rental apartments seem like a “can’t miss” investment during the pandemic. Developers piled in to take advantage by constructing millions of the multifamily units, while investors snapped up older complexes to renovate them.
content:
NEW YORK: Soaring rents and cheap funding made blocks of US rental apartments seem like a “can’t miss” investment during the pandemic. Developers piled in to take advantage by constructing millions of the multifamily units, while investors snapped up older complexes to renovate them.

Since then, borrowing costs have surged, and now there are emerging signs that some borrowers will struggle to refinance, Fitch Ratings said last Thursday.

title: Welfare body chairman nabbed over false claims in Terengganu
summary: KUALA TERENGGANU (Jan 7): The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) arrested the chairman of a welfare organisation on Sunday, for allegedly submitting false claims of RM5,000 for a non-existent school aid programme in Terengganu.
content:
KUALA TERENGGANU (Jan 7): The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) arrested the chairman of a welfare organisation on Sunday, for allegedly submitting false claims of RM5,000 for a non-existent school aid programme in Terengganu.

Sources said the suspect, a woman in her 40s, had submitted the claims to a government-linked company, purportedly for aid distributed to 11 students under the Back To School programme.

"However, the so-called aid was never

title: Meeting with Health Ministry next week to discuss Sarawak’s health autonomy request
summary: KUCHING (Jan 7): A meeting will be held next week between the Health Ministry and Sarawak Public Health, Housing and Local Government Ministry to deliberate further on the state’s request for autonomy on health matters.
content:
KUCHING (Jan 7): A meeting will be held next week between the Health Ministry and Sarawak Public Health, Housing and Local Government Ministry to deliberate further on the state’s request for autonomy on health matters.

Sarawak Deputy Premier and Minister for Public Health, Housing and Local Government Datuk Amar Dr Sim Kui Hian said the discussion process is quite complicated, as it had to go through stages before the outcome could be presented to the Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim and Sarawak P

title: Anti-Bribery Mgmt System becomes guide for HR Ministry to enhance governance, tackle bribery risk
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): The Anti-Bribery Management System (ABMS) will be a guide to all departments and agencies under the Ministry of Human Resources to strengthen governance and identify the risk of corruption and misuse of power.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): The Anti-Bribery Management System (ABMS) will be a guide to all departments and agencies under the Ministry of Human Resources to strengthen governance and identify the risk of corruption and misuse of power.

Its minister Steven Sim Chee Keong said the initiative is now used at the Skills Development Fund Corporation (PTPK) and the move is implemented with the cooperation of the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH).

title: Abdul Hadi Awang in stable condition, to be discharged soon — son
summary: KUALA TERENGGANU (Jan 7): PAS president Tan Sri Abdul Hadi Awang, who is currently being treated at the National Heart Institute (IJN) in Kuala Lumpur, is reported to be in stable condition.
content:
KUALA TERENGGANU (Jan 7): PAS president Tan Sri Abdul Hadi Awang, who is currently being treated at the National Heart Institute (IJN) in Kuala Lumpur, is reported to be in stable condition.

His son Dr Muhammad Khalil told Bernama that his father was under observation and is expected to be discharged soon.

“He is stable and under observation. After discussions, they advised that he not receive any visitors at this point. He will be discharged soon,

title: Danger-level heavy rain in Rompin, Pahang until Monday — MetMalaysia
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): The Malaysian Meteorological Department (MetMalaysia) has forecast danger-level heavy rain in Rompin, Pahang starting Sunday until Monday (Jan 8).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): The Malaysian Meteorological Department (MetMalaysia) has forecast danger-level heavy rain in Rompin, Pahang starting Sunday until Monday (Jan 8).

It has also warned of continuous, heavy rain at a severe level expected until Monday, affecting Pekan, Pahang, and several areas in Johor (Segamat, Kluang, Mersing and Kota Tinggi).

Continuous, heavy rain at an alert level is also forecast in Pahang, involving Maran, Kuantan and Bera, and Johor (

title: Mahfuz, Dr Hatta appointed Amanah vice-presidents
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Kedah Pakatan Harapan chairman Datuk Mahfuz Omar and former Parti Amanah Negara (Amanah) secretary-general Datuk Dr Mohd Hatta Ramli have been appointed as party vice presidents for the 2023-2026 term.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Kedah Pakatan Harapan chairman Datuk Mahfuz Omar and former Parti Amanah Negara (Amanah) secretary-general Datuk Dr Mohd Hatta Ramli have been appointed as party vice presidents for the 2023-2026 term.

Newly-minted Amanah secretary-general Muhammad Faiz Fadzil said the appointments had received unanimous support at the party’s National Leadership Committee (JKP) meeting on Sunday, which was chaired by president Datuk Seri Mohamad Sabu.

“Tho

title: Malaysia must take risks in forging new economic future
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Malaysia must be willing to take calculated risks in forging a new economic future for Malaysia, especially in the digital and green economies, to make investment and trade the key drivers of economic growth, Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz said.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Malaysia must be willing to take calculated risks in forging a new economic future for Malaysia, especially in the digital and green economies, to make investment and trade the key drivers of economic growth, Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz said.

He said this is one of the points being focused on by the Ministry of Investment, Trade and Industry (Miti) this year, which also includes properly executing the national plans.

title: Global Oriental to buy remaining 45 pct stake in Edisijuta Parking for RM22.5mil
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Global Oriental Bhd (GOB) plans to acquire the remaining 45 per cent equity stake in Edisijuta Parking Sdn Bhd (EPSB) for RM22.5 million in an attempt to grow its car park operations management business.  The company has entered into ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Global Oriental Bhd (GOB) plans to acquire the remaining 45 per cent equity stake in Edisijuta Parking Sdn Bhd (EPSB) for RM22.5 million in an attempt to grow its car park operations management business.

  The company has entered into a conditional share sale and purchase agreement (SPA) with Edisijuta Sdn Bhd (ESB) and Cahaya Impian Sdn Bhd to acquire an equity interest in EPSB not already owned by the group.

  GOB had acquired the initial 55 per cent stake in EPSB for RM27.5 million on October 19, 2023, to

title: Loke: Mavcom to keep an eye on holiday travel airfare prices to prevent airfar abuse
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Malaysian Aviation Commission (Mavcom) is keeping a careful eye on airfare prices during the holiday season to prevent airline price manipulation.    According to Transport Minister Anthony Loke, the government has implemented sufficient controls to prevent airlines from ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Malaysian Aviation Commission (Mavcom) is keeping a careful eye on airfare prices during the holiday season to prevent airline price manipulation. 

   According to Transport Minister Anthony Loke, the government has implemented sufficient controls to prevent airlines from making disproportionate claims from Putrajaya under the RM599 base fares initiative during the Christmas season.

  Loke said that airlines are unable to simply raise prices because the ministry is aware of every flight's specifics,

title: China to sanction five US manufacturers over arms sales to Taiwan — ministry
summary: BEIJING: China will sanction five US military manufacturers in response to the latest round of US arms sales to Taiwan, a foreign ministry spokesperson said on Sunday.US arms sales to Taiwan are a frequent source of tension between Washington ...
content:
BEIJING: China will sanction five US military manufacturers in response to the latest round of US arms sales to Taiwan, a foreign ministry spokesperson said on Sunday.

US arms sales to Taiwan are a frequent source of tension between Washington and Beijing. China views democratically governed Taiwan as its territory, a claim Taiwan's government rejects.

The sanctions come ahead of Taiwan's Jan 13 presidential and parliamentary elections, which China has cast as a choice between war and peace.

The US State D

title: Floods expected in three districts in Johor on Jan 7
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Floods are expected to hit the Kulai, Johor Bahru and Pontian districts in Johor in stages from 11am to 5pm on Sunday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Floods are expected to hit the Kulai, Johor Bahru and Pontian districts in Johor in stages from 11am to 5pm on Sunday.

The National Flood Forecasting and Warning Centre (PRABN) under the Irrigation and Drainage Department (DID), in a statement said that this was following the continuous heavy rain warning issued by the Malaysian Meteorological Department earlier on Sunday.

According to the advisory, the locations expected to experience

title: Toyota Motor to restart vehicle plants in Japan from Jan 8
summary: TOKYO: Toyota Motor said it would restart its Japanese vehicle plants on Monday (Jan 8) but given the impact of the New Year's Day earthquake, would decide separately about operations from Jan 15.As aftershocks are continuing from the magnitude 7.6 quake ...
content:
TOKYO: Toyota Motor said it would restart its Japanese vehicle plants on Monday (Jan 8) but given the impact of the New Year's Day earthquake, would decide separately about operations from Jan 15.

As aftershocks are continuing from the magnitude 7.6 quake that ravaged Japan's western coast and with many of its suppliers and their affiliates being in affected areas, Toyota said in a press release on Sunday that it would use parts in stock outside those areas.

Toyota president Koji Sato said on Friday (Jan 5) that

title: Ecoscience's unit sues RDS Marketing over RM2.4 mil unpaid dues
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Ecoscience International Bhd's (EIB) wholly-owned unit, Ecoscience Manufacturing and Engineering Sdn Bhd (EMMSB), is taking legal action against RDS Marketing Malaysia Sdn Bhd in an effort to recoup RM2.38 million in outstanding payments.  In a filing with ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Ecoscience International Bhd's (EIB) wholly-owned unit, Ecoscience Manufacturing and Engineering Sdn Bhd (EMMSB), is taking legal action against RDS Marketing Malaysia Sdn Bhd in an effort to recoup RM2.38 million in outstanding payments.

  In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the palm oil refinery builder said that EMMSB has served a writ of summons and statement of claim to RDS Marketing in the High Court of Malaya in Shah Alam, Selangor.

  The legal action stems from RDS Marketing's failure to fulfi

title: Stocks, bond prices ease in see-saw session as investors mull 'soft landing'
summary: NEW YORK/LONDON: Bond prices and a gauge of global equity performance eased in choppy trading on Friday after a surprisingly strong US employment report increased the odds that the Federal Reserve (Fed) can engineer a "soft landing" for the ...
content:
NEW YORK/LONDON: Bond prices and a gauge of global equity performance eased in choppy trading on Friday after a surprisingly strong US employment report increased the odds that the Federal Reserve (Fed) can engineer a "soft landing" for the US economy.

US employers hired more workers than expected last month while raising wages at a solid clip, leading markets to dial back bets the Fed would start cutting interest rates in March.

But a weak report from the Institute for Supply Management (ISM) that showed service sector e

title: Genting Singapore may bid for Thailand casino — Maybank IB
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Genting Singapore may bid for a casino and integrated resort licence in Thailand, should the Thai government open up the industry, according to Maybank Investment Bank Research (Maybank IB).
content:
Note: The headline and first paragraph of this article has been amended for accuracy

KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Genting Singapore may bid for a casino and integrated resort licence in Thailand, should the Thai government open up the industry, according to Maybank Investment Bank Research (Maybank IB).

Citing the research house, industry magazine Inside Asian Gaming (IAG) said the company would look to form a joint venture for a Thai IR lice

title: Lee Lam Thye, previously known as the MP with a typewriter, to present his autobiography on Jan 10
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Tan Sri Lee Lam Thye, a distinguished figure renowned for a lifetime of service to Malaysia and its people, will personally hand over copies of his autobiography on Wednesday (Jan 10), at 2pm, at the Lecadia Primacare Centre in Pudu.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Tan Sri Lee Lam Thye, a distinguished figure renowned for a lifetime of service to Malaysia and its people, will personally hand over copies of his autobiography on Wednesday (Jan 10), at 2pm, at the Lecadia Primacare Centre in Pudu.

The autobiography, titled "Lee Lam Thye: Recalling a Lifetime of Service"', delves into Tan Sri Lee's political career, in which he served in the Selangor State Assembly and represented the parliamentary constituency of Bukit Bintang for four terms, said a st

title: Wall Street ends topsy-turvy day marginally up
summary: US stock indices endured a topsy-turvy session on Friday but ultimately closed marginally higher, as investors absorbed the latest macroeconomic data which offered contrasting views on when interest rate cuts may begin.In terms of weekly performance, both the S&...
content:
US stock indices endured a topsy-turvy session on Friday but ultimately closed marginally higher, as investors absorbed the latest macroeconomic data which offered contrasting views on when interest rate cuts may begin.

In terms of weekly performance, both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite ended the first week of 2024 with notable negative performance: The S&P 500 recorded its worst weekly performance since late October, while the Nasdaq posted its worst week since late September.

After a week of negative performan

title: Higher education institutions should be receptive to industry players’ suggestions when developing syllabus
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Higher education institutions (IPTs) are advised to be receptive to suggestions from industry players when formulating their academic syllabus.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): Higher education institutions (IPTs) are advised to be receptive to suggestions from industry players when formulating their academic syllabus.

PKT Logistic Group Sdn Bhd chief executive officer Datuk Seri Dr Micheal Tio said with their better insights into the development of their respective sectors, industry leaders may assist IPTs in preventing mismatches between academic syllabuses and the actual needs of industries, ensuring higher employability for graduates.

title: Housing developers in Sarawak no longer obligated to build affordable homes
summary: KUCHING: Private housing developers planning on developing large-scale projects in Sarawak are no longer required to build affordable homes starting from the first quarter of this year, Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg said.Instead, he said developers ...
content:
KUCHING: Private housing developers planning on developing large-scale projects in Sarawak are no longer required to build affordable homes starting from the first quarter of this year, Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg said.

Instead, he said developers involved in projects that span 10 acres or more are required to make compensation in lieu through a housing trust fund which would allow the state government to use these funds for the development of affordable homes on the specific project sites.

"We will im

title: Oil prices rise over US$1 on Middle East tensions
summary: LONDON: Oil prices rose by over US$1 on Friday as US Secretary of State Antony Blinken prepared to visit the Middle East to try to contain regional tensions as the Israel-Hamas conflict rages.Brent crude futures LCOc1 were up US$1.10, ...
content:
LONDON: Oil prices rose by over US$1 on Friday as US Secretary of State Antony Blinken prepared to visit the Middle East to try to contain regional tensions as the Israel-Hamas conflict rages.

Brent crude futures LCOc1 were up US$1.10, or 1.42 per cent, at US$78.69 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures CLc1 rose US$1.45, or 2.01 per cent, to US$73.64 by 1551 GMT.

Both benchmarks are on track to end the first week of the year higher, having recouped losses from Thursday that were triggered by hefty incre

title: CPO futures end higher on stronger soybean oil prices
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives ended higher Friday on stronger soybean oil prices as well as ongoing concern over lower production.Palm oil trader David Ng said anticipation of lower stockpiles in ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives ended higher Friday on stronger soybean oil prices as well as ongoing concern over lower production.

Palm oil trader David Ng said anticipation of lower stockpiles in the country also supported the prices of the golden commodity.

"We see support at RM3,600 a tonne and resistance at RM3,750 a tonne," he told Bernama.

Meanwhile, Mumbai-based Sunvin Group commodity research head Anilkumar Bagani said CPO futures were seen trading high

title: Tentative trading of ringgit seen next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Trading on the ringgit is expected to remain cautious next week, with all eyes on major data points such as the US nonfarm payroll (NFP) data which will be critical for ringgit-US dollar performance.Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Trading on the ringgit is expected to remain cautious next week, with all eyes on major data points such as the US nonfarm payroll (NFP) data which will be critical for ringgit-US dollar performance.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said the trading of  the ringgit would be tentative next week.

"Should the NFP turn out to be better than expected, the ringgit could stay weak next week, possibly around RM4.65 which is quite near its immediate resistant level of RM4.6611

content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trend higher next week, moving in the 1,470-1,500 range on persistent optimism for the local bourse.

Rakuten Trade equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said fueled by favourable market indicators, the FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI (FBM KLCI) is forecast to remain above the 1,465 level for an extended period, a threshold it struggled to maintain several times last year.

title: FBM KLCI futures expected to move higher next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI (FBM KLCI) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to move higher next week on persistent optimism for the local equity market.Rakuten Trade equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said that ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI (FBM KLCI) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to move higher next week on persistent optimism for the local equity market.

Rakuten Trade equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said that fueled by favourable market indicators, the FBM KLCI is forecast to remain above the 1,465 level for an extended period, a threshold it struggled to maintain several times last year.

title: Gold futures likely to trade at current level next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Gold futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade at the current level next week amid the uncertainty in the global economy.SPI Asset Management managing director Stephen Innes said buyers were awaiting the release of ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Gold futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade at the current level next week amid the uncertainty in the global economy.

SPI Asset Management managing director Stephen Innes said buyers were awaiting the release of US job data next week as it would determine the market's direction.

"The upcoming jobs report for December, scheduled for release later, holds the potential to influence the gold market next week," he told Bernama.

title: CPO futures likely to trade with upward bias next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade with an upward bias next week given the expectations of low output as well as rebound in export demand, said palm oil trader ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade with an upward bias next week given the expectations of low output as well as rebound in export demand, said palm oil trader David Ng. 

"Currently we are in seasonally lower production and the recent floods in certain key growing areas also affected output. China may resume buying of CPO ahead of the Lunar New Year next month.

"Hence, we expect prices to move between RM3,600 and RM3,820 per tonne next week," he told

title: Team effort
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): As we usher in the new year, National Cancer Society Malaysia (NCSM) is kick-starting its new HPV vaccination programme, in partnership with the Ministry of Health. In conjunction with Cervical Cancer Awareness Month, NCSM managing director Dr Murallitharan Munisamy, together with Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr Dzulkefly Ahmad, share insights on the endeavour — one of the foremost initiatives in which the government, private entities and non-profit bodies are teaming up.
content:

title: KJTS plans to raise RM58.9 million
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: KJTS Group Bhd plans to raise RM58.9 million from its initial public offering (IPO) upon its listing on the ACE Market of Bursa Malaysia on Jan 26, 2024.  The IPO comprised the issuance of 218.03 million new shares at 27 sen per ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: KJTS Group Bhd plans to raise RM58.9 million from its initial public offering (IPO) upon its listing on the ACE Market of Bursa Malaysia on Jan 26, 2024.

  The IPO comprised the issuance of 218.03 million new shares at 27 sen per share.

  The IPO proceeds will be allocated RM44.9 million for business expansion, including RM40.4 million for the cooling 

energy segment and RM4.5 million for office expansion in Malaysia, Thailand, and Singapore.

title: More than 15 IPOs expected this year, say analysts
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia has become a new initial public offerings (IPO) hotspot market, surpassing traditional IPO powerhouses with notable increases in both transaction volume and proceeds.  According to Ernst and Young's (EY) EY Global IPO Trends 2023 report, Malaysia experienced ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia has become a new initial public offerings (IPO) hotspot market, surpassing traditional IPO powerhouses with notable increases in both transaction volume and proceeds.

  According to Ernst and Young's (EY) EY Global IPO Trends 2023 report, Malaysia experienced a significant surge in the number of IPOs last year, outpacing the 5-year average by 21 per cent, and a 25 per cent increase in IPO proceeds over the 5-year average.

title: Greater demand seen in 2H
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Rubber products industry is expected to see a substantial demand recovery trend in the second half of 2024 (2H24) before glovemakers recommence capacity expansions by 2025/2026. Recent export data suggests a positive demand recovery sign that coincides with steady ASP ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Rubber products industry is expected to see a substantial demand recovery trend in the second half of 2024 (2H24) before glovemakers recommence capacity expansions by 2025/2026. 

Recent export data suggests a positive demand recovery sign that coincides with steady ASP performance, according to RHB Research. 

The firm said further normalisation in gas tariffs and various cost discipline measures in place could eventually propel profitability in 2024.

title: Designing the spaces of tomorrow
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): In the first of a two-part series, some of our nation’s next-generation architects that have the capacity to influence the future of Malaysian architecture share why they chose the profession, how their designs can transform the country’s built environment and their hopes for the industry. They each showcase one completed project that best represents their work as an architect and talk about their design approach.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 7): In the first of a two-part series, some of our nation’s next-generation architects that have the capacity to influence the future of Malaysian architecture share why they chose the profession, how their designs can transform the country’s built environment and their hopes for the industry. They each showcase one completed project that best represents their work as an architect and talk about their design approach.
